BibiCreator 01 documentation
modules | index

src.threads package¶

Submodules¶

src.threads.cleanUpThread module¶

This module is responsible for keeping the integrity between local data and database.

class src.threads.cleanUpThread.JobCleaner(app)¶

Bases: threading.Thread

Class with the job to clean up false links in the module database.

__init__(app)¶

Initiliazes a JobCleaner object.

Parameters:app – The flask app context.
run()¶

Runs the thread in an eternal loop, checking constantly the integrity of the database.

src.threads.cleanUpThread.dirIntegrity(module_path, modlist)¶

Checks if module files from database are existing on the local machine.

Parameters:
  • module_path – The installation script path of the module.
  • modlist – A list of modules.

src.threads.integrityThread module¶

WARNING: deprecated. Needs to be deleted.

class src.threads.integrityThread.IntegrityCheck(app)¶

Bases: threading.Thread

Not used anymore in the system. (deprecated)

__init__(app)¶
run()¶

src.threads.threadManager module¶

This module contains the thread manager, which keeps track of all packer-workerthreads. It removes and restarts soft locked threads.

class src.threads.threadManager.ThreadManager(app)¶

Bases: threading.Thread

The ThreadManager manages all worker and integrity threads from BibiCreator

__init__(app)¶

Start up the threadmanager.

Parameters:app – The flask app context.
checkForTTL(secondsToLive)¶

Checks the uptime of all workerthreads, which are currently building a new Image. Shut down the thread if the process takes too long.

Parameters:secondsToLive – Threshold of time to live for this thread.
run()¶

Spins up all 5 worker threads.

src.threads.workerThread module¶

Main worker thread for executing pending build jobs.

class src.threads.workerThread.JobWorker(app, lock)¶

Bases: threading.Thread

A thread which is responsibel for building new linux images into openstack.

__init__(app, lock)¶

Initializes a new worker thread.

Parameters:
  • app – The flask app context.
  • lock – A reference to a mutex lock.
run()¶
shutDownPacker()¶

If the packer process is soft locked, we can try to force shut it down.

src.threads.workerThread.cp_booksAndScripts(job, logfile, directory_trgt, module_type)¶

Copies Ansible playbooks and bash scripts to the working directory.

Parameters:
  • job – The targeted job object from database.
  • logfile – The logfile of the working directory.
  • directory_trgt – Location of the working directory.
  • module_type – Is this a Playbook or a Bash Script?
Raises:

Exception – Could not access role, maybe because it is not existent.
src.threads.workerThread.cp_booksAndScriptsForced(logfile, directory_trgt)¶

Copies FORCED Ansible playbooks and bash scripts to the working directory.

Parameters:
  • logfile – The logfile of the working directory.
  • directory_trgt – Location of the working directory.
Raises:

Exception – Could not access role, maybe because it is not existent.
src.threads.workerThread.cp_roles(job, logfile, ansible_roles_path)¶

Copies Ansible Roles from the locale database to the working directory.

Parameters:
  • job – A orm job object from database.
  • logfile – A file descriptor for logging outputs.
  • ansible_roles_path – In which working directory shall these roles be installed?
Raises:

Exception – Could not access role, maybe because it is not existent.
src.threads.workerThread.cp_rolesForced(logfile, ansible_roles_path)¶

Copies FORCED Ansible Roles from the locale database to the working directory.

Parameters:
  • job – A orm job object from database.
  • logfile – A file descriptor for logging outputs.
  • ansible_roles_path – In which working directory shall these roles be installed?
Raises:

Exception – Could not access role, maybe because it is not existent.
src.threads.workerThread.installFromGalaxy(job, logfile, ansible_roles_path)¶

Installs Ansible Roles from Ansible Galaxy to the working directory of a build process.

Parameters:
  • job – A orm job object from database.
  • logfile – A file descriptor for the worker logfile.
  • ansible_roles_path – The location on where to install the galaxy roles.
Raises:

Exception – Ansible Galaxy was not able to install a role.
